[SPELLING]: Typo ("ol" instead of "of" in "the outlines ol which").
[SYNTAX]: Occasionally overly complex sentence structures (e.g., long descriptive sentences).

[LOGIC]: Abrupt, unrelated sections (e.g., Bahá’u’lláh discussion, "Père Cars" anecdote) disrupt narrative flow.
[STRUCTURE]: Lack of transitional links between disparate topics (ethnography, philosophy, biography).

[SYNTAX]: Overly complex, multi-clause sentences (e.g., women’s head-dress description).

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt, unrelated paragraph about Sir Joshua Reynolds disrupting thematic flow.
[TRANSITION]: Lack of logical connection between household descriptions and craft activities.
